faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions about the Job Worth Calculator

items.question: How accurate is Job Worth Calculator?
items.answer: The calculator is based on a scientific salary evaluation model that considers multiple dimensions including salary, work hours, and environmental factors. While not 100% precise, it provides an objective reference for your job evaluation.

items.question: What does PPP (Purchasing Power Parity) mean in Job Worth Calculator?
items.answer: PPP is a purchasing power parity index used to compare the actual purchasing power of currencies in different countries. The calculator uses PPP data to make salaries from different countries comparable.

items.question: Will the data generated by Job Worth Calculator be saved?
items.answer: All calculations in Job Worth Calculator are performed locally in your browser, and data is not uploaded to servers. History records are only saved in your browser, ensuring privacy and security.

items.question: How to understand the Job Worth Calculator score?
items.answer: A higher score indicates better job value. Generally: below 0.6 is terrible, 0.6-1.0 is poor, 1.0-1.8 is average, 1.8-2.5 is good, 2.5-3.2 is great, 3.2-4.0 is excellent, and above 4.0 is perfect.

items.question: Which countries and regions does Job Worth Calculator support?
items.answer: Currently supports PPP data for 190+ countries and regions worldwide, covering major developed and developing countries. Data is sourced from authoritative institutions like the World Bank.

items.question: Can the calculation results from Job Worth Calculator be shared?
items.answer: Yes! You can generate a shareable link or save it as an image to share your job value analysis results with friends and colleagues.

items.question: üñ•Ô∏è How to use Job Worth Calculator
items.answer:
1. Enter annual salary
2. Select country/region of work
3. Fill in job details (work days per week, work hours, commute time, etc.)
4. Specify environmental factors (city, work environment, team, etc.)
5. Enter education and work experience
6. View the job value score and detailed assessment
7. Generate a shareable report

items.question: üìä How Job Worth Calculator calculates the score
items.answer:
The job value score is calculated using a comprehensive formula that considers:
- Standardized daily salary (adjusted for PPP)
- Working hours (work days per week, work hours)
- Commute time (daily commute duration)
- Work environment factors (office location, team relationships)
- Education bonus (adjusted for educational level)
- Experience adjustment (adjusted for years of work experience)
